good. good to have a nice time watching the mayan show the dancers who fly from a post attached to a rope .
Beautiful landmark. There were performers and such there, which made it pretty fun. The shopping here is awesome. I took a picture here that is now the desktop on my computer screen!

A Must Visit. Always Something happening, here in this wonderful square of Parque Los Fundadores. Located next to the ferry, that goes back and forth from Playa Del Carmen to Cozumel. Don't forge to bring your sunblock and comfy shoes.
stop over. Nice little park to stop by on the way to the ferry to Cozumel Great place to just sit and people watch

Good people watching area. The town square near the cozumel ferry is a hive of activity. It is at the far north end of 5th ave. There are shows/entertainment in the square, places to sit & people watch & the huge statue to view & watch the ferries come & go. Go & see the statue as the sun rises & it looks like the statue figures are reaching for the sun. Hawkers are everywhere so just say 'no gracias' & don't make eye contact unless you are interested.

Shopping. Great shops and such a wide variety but prepare to be approached by most shop keepers to get you into the shop also people on the street saying they've met you before as its a ploy to get you into a shop and learn to haggle over prices keep all this in mind and you'll have a great time x

Beautiful view. Had the opportunity to see this beautiful sculpture during my first trip into the city. There were Voladores performing in the square which was quite a treat. Locals were hanging out, tourists taking it all in. It was quite the microcosm.

Park at the end of 5th Ave. This park is where 5th Ave and Benito Juarez meet. Its also right beside the place where you can catch the ferry to Cozumel. The sculpture is interesting, but nothing mind-boggling. There are lots of benches to have a seat and read a book, however unfortunately every 30 seconds you will be bothered by some hawker trying to sell you jewelry, ice cream, tours, etc. There is no peace to be had here. Plus when I was here the seaweed was bad so the park stunk like rotten eggs.
Shopping. Our whole family enjoyed walking down 5th Ave and looking in the shops!! Love how they keep everything looking nice! Love the new mall!!

Shopping on 5th ave. There was plenty of shopping but it was high pressure from owners to shop in their store and the really tried to put on the pressure.I shopped at the Playamart which is kinda like a 5 and dime. They had a little bit of everything and no pressure to buy. Prices were reasonable and there was no negotiating like most of the other retailers.it definitely is something to experience .right in front of this picture is a small beautiful church. Buyer beware!

Beautiful !!!!. This is the view or the water gods, just by the ferry dock in playa, when the sun is up the rays come threw the tope of the statue making it look like the gods are reaching for the sky, Amazing !!

A must stop for everyone in Playa Del Carmen. This place has changed a lot over the years, all for the better. Everyone going to Playa should check it out. A cool place to hang out in the evenings. Great for people watching!

Pretty & Fun. Cool area to walk around, shop, take photos! This was a nicer area of the beach. There is always something fun happening! The Marreache band playing up the top of the really high pole was amazing!
good view of the bech. it was right in the middle of 5th avenue near a beautiful church that you could visit there where a lot of places to tak e pictures of the beach and see the ferry boat

a bit disappointed - but impressed by the wheelchair access to beach. arrived here expecting more than what was there, a few 'Mexican' stalls and a couple of places to get a cold drink, and a seating area. Did really like that they had wheelchair access to the beach.
Love this place. What can I say. I just love this place. Beautiful clean beach and warm friendly people with plenty of sunshine. Who can ask for much more than this.
very nice day out. this is a wonderfull town lots to do fantastic views i def recamend a vist lovely shops very safe must see

What a beatiful bronze. In this center square is a show, where the locals are closing the day with a ritual that is not to miss. and a quiet place to sit and watch the ocean. Be aware of the merchants who say..remember me I was your waiter...such a bad lie...if you are wearing a wrist band from the resort you are staying they comment on the resort as well. They were not to happy with me as I called them liar. Most of the merchants were fun to haggle with.
NICE VIEW, CLEAN SIDE OF THE BEACH THIS YEAR.. It was very nice. There was a show you could sit and watch. Never had really explored this end of the beach.
Park is pretty Cool. Lots to see and do - the guys on the pole are crazy !!! Cant explain - you HAVE to see it ! Lots of fresh fruit vendors - missed the guy doing spray painting art (sad)

Playa del Carmen, Cancun Riviera Maya. This park was very relaxing, you can also do a little shopping, there is a small but very cute church. Good restaurants if you decide to eat, and the best is the beack.

Nice sculpture.. This place is at the very end or beginning of Quinta Avenida, depending on which direction you come from. It's a great place for a nice picture, if you're coming to Quinta Avenida anyway.
Went to cozumel on the ferry. Went to Iberostar Cozumel sister resort to the one we had in Rivera Maya. Cozumel has the smallest Hard Rock Cafe in the world
Interesting. Nice place but to much hassle from the shop owners would be much better if you was left to browse without the hassle you would buy more
nice. I would suggest a stop at this park just to see the sculpture. Plenty of low priced shopping but be prepared to be harassed by people trying to sell you something.

Beautiful and accessible in chair wheels . If you want to spend an evening with friends or family walking around but you have a beloved one using a chair wheel it is not easy to find the perfect place, but Playa del Carmen offers amphibious vehicles, this is amazing so everyone can enjoy this Paradise.

A place for a quick visit. Nice beach but tthere are oo many people harassing tourists to sell all kinds of things. We decided to leave rather than keep telling people we did not want to buy what they offered.
good pictures. pretty much just a place to sit around and relaxing.; public access to the beach. just blocks from 5th avenue.

Busy, shop owners hassle. Hard to walk and enjoy the area without shop owners dangling flyers from their own version of fishing poles, trying to lure you into their stores. Pun intended. Sculpture at shoreline unique and worth a photo but that's about it.

POPULAR PLACE - MUST VISIT IF IN PLAYA DEL CARMEN. It was our first time that we made it to this Park, so impressive and full of life. Parque Fundadores commemorates the Founders of Playa del Carmen. "It is a significant historical location within the city, originally a community gathering spot where residents obtained water, food and basic living essentials, this seaside location was the market hub for the then small village". (Taste of Playa") I strongly recommend.

pretty area next to port. Nice beach area and shopping next to the local pier to and from Cozumel, can be very busy during the day with locals and tourist accessing the ferry port.A must see is to witness the amazing men who climb a very high pole and then swing upside down

Found interesting finds. The beach was nice (although I didn’t bring my bikini on my trip here, which I regretted), and the market stalls were filled with interesting finds. Most places sold almost the same things. Try to haggle with the store owners, they are used to it. We mostly shopped in the bigger stores because I hate haggling, and enjoy seeing the prices right on the items so that I can mentally decide if I want the item or not. There are so many restaurants to choose from, and this is where you can also buy some tours from that are cheaper than the resorts. Overall I had a very interesting day here.

A Nice and Beautiful place to be at Sunset!. A Nice and Beautiful place to be at Sunset! There was a live show performed by Dancers at sunset with Drums. Very fun to watch. Keep in mind there will be a performer that will come around looking for a donation.

Uuu!. I thought that there are two mermaids trying to hug each other, but when I got closier - its a couple, I think it's pretty romantic place, especially in the evening. And also locals are doing performances there,- It's nice!

Essential photo opportunity. We just had to start our evening here. There was a fire eating act on, when we went. Very good, free entertainment with a great atmosphere. Best time to go, is early evening just as the sun is setting. Simply unforgettable and romantic. We positioned ourselves just beneath the two ladies and managed to get a passer by, to take our photo. The best part was that they returned the phone to us instead of running off with it, which is always a worry.
Pretty nice. Nice place, beatiful statut with a nice background of the carabean see. Dances and shows on the place all day. Nice restaurant all around, a bit small but cosy.
Take a seat and relax a bit. Lots going on here. Performers, playground for young children, food vendors, and a nice place to take a break.

Fun little park. Excellent place to take pictures. There was a live band playing on the Sunday that we visited. Nice beach with lots of families enjoying the sun and sand. You'll find lots of vendors here. I especially enjoyed the cold, fresh pineapple (on a stick).

Stumbled upon a very cool performance.. When we arrived there was a cultural performance going on. It was very cool, They climbed about 50 feet up in the air on a pole and came down attached to ropes in a choreographed display. Very nice to stumble upon.
playa de carmen. Taxi to playa de carmen costs roughly £10 each way,hundreds of shops and bars,staff try to sell you things but they aren't rude and you can share a bit of banter with them
Arches. Beautiful place for pictures. Very Clean! Lots of people. Close to where the boats were to go to Cozmel.
A really fun park to visit.. this was a gorgeous park with local performers and right in the middle of a ton of shopping. If you want something fun to do for the day, this is a great place to visit.

Pushy Vendors. I hated going in to any shop because the shop owners harass you from the moment you enter their store. Some might find this an interesting feature of the Mexican culture, but I was very uncomfortable. I would have bought much more if I was just left alone to browse items on my own. I couldn't get out of there fast enough!

Better deals if you walk off a block or two. But the atmosphere is awesome!. Very neat place. Lots to see. Lots to shop. You get better deals if you walk a block or two off 5th ave. The Cenote restaurant was awesome and the staff was super friendly. Be prepared to be hassled to buy jewellery and look in every single persons shop. Don't make eye contact lol Definitely a great experience none the less. I went with a friend one day and on my own on another day and I felt safe and was able to get some great deals.
shop and swim. beautiful sculpture ..beach clean and quiet...nice area plus shopping..really hot..wear a hat...wear sunblock...good deals on the avenue..better at the end of street....
Nothing special. Nothing special just a square at the start/end of 5th avenue. Monument as shown in this picture is beautiful though.
review. was a cool place to see,was in downtown playa had some type of local concert going on at the time we were there

lovely park for pictures at the ferry to Cozumel. very beautiful park next to the ferry that takes you over to Cozumel. We got some beautiful pictures there. If you can make it through the 5th Avenue nightmare, it is beautiful.
Beach arch in Playa del Carmen. Beautiful spot for pictures and a walk along the beach when you need a break from shopping on 5th Avenue.

If you like people watching. We were able to experience the local culture in the square. We interacted with local people and learned their history. The Indian dancing under the arc was cool. But beware of pick pockets. It's very busy and easy to get distracted. Pay attention to your surroundings .

Mexico holiday. We visited about 3rd and what a lovely square to sit and have a drink. Lovely views out to sea watching the ferries. Lots of entertainment when we were there, Indian dancing and flying men -these were amazing.
Beach in the city. Beautiful place !!! lots of entertainment all free and the scenery is out of this world and yes you are right down town too. A must see ....

Nice sight when heading to the ferry. Such a neat place to take a picture, we came in the morning before the cruise ships let the passengers off, so it was quiet here at the park. The view cannot be beat, I wish we had more time to sit and look out over the water.

Lovely square. A lovely place just to enjoy a quick drink/bite to eat. Lots of little stalls around the perimeter and just off 5th Avenue, there's plenty to do and a stroll down the beach never hurt anybody! When I was there Mexico and the Gulf had a huge seaweed problem, whether that will become a recurring issue is unknown to anybody. It didn't bother me too much but I can understand it could put some people off.
mexico anniversary 2015. Lovely place to have a beer or an ice cream this statue in person is amazing the faces on the women are lovely very nice plaza
Sit and watch the world go by. This is quite a nice place to watch the world go by,and just take a rest from shopping,good photo opportunities,I loved this place,very relaxing

An ongoing seaweed issue. The Parque has lots of attractions, particularly the Danza de los Voladores (Flying Dancers), however the entire coastline of Playa Del Carmen has suffered an ingress of seaweed for over twelve months and the smell is very off-putting. Major hotels and beach clubs clean up their brach frontage (daily?) but the public areas and the ongoing smell is very unpleasant. You even get wafts of smell while walking down Quinta Avenida.If you are prepared and aren't that sensitive to smell, then this is worth a visit. Otherwise, you may wish to reconsider staying outside of Playa Del Carmen (Cozumel is an option) and making day trips. Just be sure you ask your hotel about any smells from the seaweed.
N. They have native Mayan Indians playing indigenous instruments as they climb a tall pole and descend swirling around Very interesting

Wodnerful Addition to Playa Del Carmen. absolutely wonderful addition to the area, (I hadn't been back since 2009) this park was not there when I last traveled, wonderful way to see some authentic Mexican traditions/ceremonies and the kids got to play in the sand park.
worth the trip to playa del carmen. its so beautiful here, u have to come and experieince the show they put on.. its a very busy area, u are with all the locals hanging out here too.
Relax and Pics.. Great place to take pictures Meet your friends, and to sit and relax. This is one really neat statue. There are bars there to enjoy.
smells like **!!!!. Don't go to this beach, currently it is invaded by seaweed, which are so stink that I can't stay at this beach more than a minute.

Fundadores Park. This is a oceanside park in Playa Del Carmen near the Ferry terminal. There just happened to be some local performers putting on a show that night. This is nice place to relax while shopping on 5th avenue.

Culture + free beach = ¡Sí!. We had an hour and a half to kill between our awesome visit to Rio Secreto and our ferry back to Cozumel and our cruise ship, so we walked over to the public beach right by the Cozumel ferry pier.I had no idea that while my kids were enjoying the waves, I'd be watching an amazing cultural display with music, dancing, and some very daring men twirling down from a pole in the middle of the plaza, dangling by one ankle!The only reason I gave it 4 instead of 5 stars (well, two reasons) - I didn't see any bathroom facilities, and the jackhammer sounds from the construction happening in/near the plaza made it a little hard to relax. :)
